messages: 2a2abac9fe12b1c3b634e42b29363c4d (23:18): hi there, i'm getting excited about creating a point-to-point link with a neighbor on our roofs, but it gets so hot here in the summer that i don't want to put an AP out there. how long can an rf cable reach between an antenna and a wireless card? with a booster?
36cf1572e3313547d71ff918326ab0d5 (23:19): if the ap is in an enclosure in the shade it shouldn't be a problem
2a2abac9fe12b1c3b634e42b29363c4d (23:20): is it really impractical to use long rf cables?

76253aeb87fc9e7d9ebc49e24c415cd1 (23:22): napkin, long RF cable runs must be with mw frequency rated low-loss cables, since we are talking mw output here, every db loss incurred will count in making a stable link.
36cf1572e3313547d71ff918326ab0d5 (23:22): J4k3, how do you protect your ap's? metal enclosures?
36cf1572e3313547d71ff918326ab0d5 (23:22): I imagine it gets quite hot in texas...

9a2c47ebaf5fdb05a80a325809046246 (23:22): hi does anyone here use the routerOS.   I am having trouble connecting to the ethernet interface to manage the unit.   I can ping the ip address but I can't connect to it ..
76253aeb87fc9e7d9ebc49e24c415cd1 (23:23): mw frequency rated low-loss cable, such as LMR400 is $$$
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (23:24): metal = static resistant, seems to dump off heat well..
2a2abac9fe12b1c3b634e42b29363c4d (23:25): i wonder if anyone has had success with long usb cables, putting the card outside with an AP inside

71d6407f2c7ffee60e7f5ec2361e3d02 (23:30): i have a wrt54gl flashed to dd-wrt.. but after a while of use.. its having issues looking like dns-issues.. some pages cannot be opened.. others very slow.. etc
71d6407f2c7ffee60e7f5ec2361e3d02 (23:31): a reboot of the router fixes it
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (23:31): of course, I love me some openwrt.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (23:31): so that makes me biased.
71d6407f2c7ffee60e7f5ec2361e3d02 (23:32): is 1492 too much when using pppoe?
71d6407f2c7ffee60e7f5ec2361e3d02 (23:33): could that be causing the problem?
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (23:33): it'll make things VERY weird.

a47c94072f549103c6f3f61cc8939f73 (00:25): try an antenna site close to you
